Edit: 
Made some adjustments:
Fighter 6 / Wizard 24 / DD 10 split now.
Base AB 38 now. I felt it needed more. Ending HP 516 (I felt it had enough). 
Dropped EMA. But one can drop AB by swapping two great dex feats for EMA and armor skin for +6 AC overall + item versatility in a +5 environment. 
Getting AB up is valuable but EMA brings a lot to the table, including being immune to Mords and Breaches.
Defensive kit is already pretty strong, will need to assess the balance.

Original post:

Another interesting idea I came up with:

Dwarven defender, dex based so one can go robed, 10 levels to protect dex AC and reduce physical damage by 6/-
Boost cons up to 21+ for EDR III (9/- physical damage reduction)
Go high level wizard for further damage reduction with Epic Warding / Epic Mage Armor
Fighter to help meet requirements, grant a few bonus feats and weapon specialisation to increase damage.

Really tough to fit everything into this. 
- Base melee AB 36. BAB 26 for 4 APR. WS/EWS (+6dmg/hit), Blind Fight, Knockdown, Weapon Finesse, simple/martial weapon proficiencies
- HP 544, defensive awareness, 15/- physical damage reduction (DD10, EDR III), light/medium/heavy/shield proficiency, +11 to saves against spells
- 'undispellable' Wizard 9 no DC spellbook (base 5-6 spells per day/spell level), Extend/Empower/Maximise, Scribe Scroll/Craft Wand, Epic Warding/Epic Mage Armor
- 227 skill points which I put into concentration, discipline, spellcraft, spot, tumble, search

I do utilise some wizard bonus feat cheese, meaning level 9 wizard spells are taken at wizard 20 rather than wizard 17 which is unfortunate, but probably understandable given how much I am trying to pack into this build.

In the ECB archives all of the Wizard / DD builds I saw dump the AB (probably for good reason), so this seems somewhat novel to me.

Anyway I thought I would put this up for your review. 

Tough to kill with a full wizard spellbook and a useful attack is what this looks like to me, stick up a few damage shields for the meleers, wands of ILMS/bigby's for the ranged, great saves against spells but unfortunately one is still probably going to need to call a monk friend to deal with the no DC bigby / IGMS casting mages
